articles.title: Greetings to Indian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Indian President
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Pranab Mukherjee, president of the Republic of India, on its national day.
					 Kim in his message wished the president good health and bigger success in his work for the country's progress and people's well-being, expressing belief that the long-standing and traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and India would grow stronger in various fields.

articles.title: Greetings to Governor-General of Australia
articles.content:
Greetings to Governor-General of Australia
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Peter Cosgrove, governor-general of the Commonwealth of Australia, on its national day.
					 The message hoped that the relations between the DPRK and Australia would develop on good terms in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Indian Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
articles.content:
Indian Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Indian Ambassador to the DPRK Jasminder Kasturia gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Tuesday on the occasion of the Day of the Republic.
					 Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, Ri Myong San, Kim Hyong Hun and other officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Present there were members of the Indian embassy.
					
					 The Indian ambassador said in his speech that the Republic of India would value and boost the traditional friendly relations with the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed hope that the tension would be defused in Korea and its reunification be achieved peacefully through dialogue.
					
					 He said that Marshal Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, has paid deep attention to the development of the friendly relations between the two countries, expressing belief that the cause of building a thriving nation in the DPRK would be successfully accomplished under his wise leadership. 
					
					 Ri Su Yong said in his speech that since the founding of the Republic, the Indian government and people have made big successes in the work for building a powerful state such as economic construction and sci-tech development, meeting all sorts of challenges of history.
					
					 He noted that he was pleased to see the bilateral exchange and cooperation become brisk between the DPRK and India.
					
					 He stressed that it is an unchangeable will to give importance to the friendly and cooperative relations with India and grow strong in all fields in conformity with the requirements of the developing era and the interests and desire of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Bactericidal Immuno-agent Developed
articles.content:
Bactericidal Immuno-agent Developed
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Bactericidal immuno-agent, developed by Pyongyang Agricultural College under Kim Il Sung University, has proved effective in greenhouse farming.
					 In this regard, Pak Ki Dok, a researcher of the college, told KCNA:
					
					 The immuno-agent helps promote germination, blossoming and fructification while building up resistance of vegetables and crops to drought and coldness. The agent has been introduced into greenhouse farming at different units, proving efficacious against different fungous and bacterial diseases.
					
					 When the agent is sprayed upon leaves of greenhouse vegetables, it takes the effect of restraining bacteria, deepening the color of vegetables and hastening their growth.

articles.title: Operation on Acute Aortic Dissection Succeeded in DPRK
articles.content:
Operation on Acute Aortic Dissection Succeeded in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The Cardiopathy Hospital under the Korea General Red Cross Hospital succeeded in the operation on acute aortic dissection.
					 According to vice-director of the specialized hospital Kim Yong Chol, the success in the operation on aortic dissection is of great significance in the nation's development of cardiovascular surgery.
					
					 Kim said:
					
					 A 59 year-old woman had an operation for acute aortic dissection.
					
					 The woman was in a critical situation due to total dissection from proximal ascending aorta to abdominal aorta which would have been led to aorta rupture.
					
					 After the successful operation, she got rid of aorta rupture and is progressing favorably.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Escalating Military Tension, Danger of War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Escalating Military Tension, Danger of War
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is the arch criminal screwing up the military tension and increasing the danger of war in the Korean Peninsula, quite contrary to the desire of the Korean nation for peace and national reunification, under the pretext of observing various "pacts and agreements" with south Korea, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. staged madcap nuclear war drills against the DPRK on an annual basis, the main factor of escalating the tension and danger of war in the peninsula.
					
					 It has staged a countless number of nuclear war drills in south Korea under various codenames over the last more than 60 years since the Korean War.
					
					 The U.S. mapped out war scenarios against the DPRK including OPLAN 5027, OPLAN 5029 and OPLAN 5030 to cope with the contingency in the peninsula. Pursuant to them, it staged ceaseless saber-rattling, posing grave threat to the DPRK and bringing dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over the peninsula.
					
					 In August last year the U.S. hurled into south Korea the south Korea-U.S. combined division and huge war hardware whose mission is reportedly to "dislodge the headquarters and occupy Pyongyang." It conducted the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises with all its operation command posts in combat readiness. It even invented doubtful "incidents of mine explosion and shelling from the north" and hurled the south Korean warmongers into a grave military provocation, pushing the situation in the peninsula to the brink of a war all of a sudden.
					
					 History and reality go to clearly prove that the U.S. is the most shameless aggressor, the root cause of misfortunes and sufferings of the south Koreans and represents the bellicose forces blocking the reconciliation and unity of the Korean nation and the reunification of Korea and increasing the danger of a nuclear war.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Mind Its Own Business before Taking Issue with Others' Human Rights
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Mind Its Own Business before Taking Issue with Others' Human Rights
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- According to a recent Romanian TV broadcasting program, the total number of Americans who lost their lives in the American Civil War, U.S.-Spanish War, the First and Second World Wars, Korean War, Vietnamese War and many other wars in the history of the U.S. is 1.2 million while the number of those who were killed owing to gun-related crimes inside the U.S. in peace time is 1.4 million. This clearly proves that the U.S. is a veritable hell on earth. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says this in a commentary. 
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 Gun-related crimes have become malignant tumor as individuals in the U.S. are allowed to carry guns legally and the use of arms has become "culture." 
					
					 Any measure to ban individuals' carriage of guns makes it impossible to protect people from criminals. Conniving at individuals' carriage of guns makes individuals' excessive use of guns problematic. To make matters worse, even arms producers are strongly opposing the arms control measure under the patronage of Congress. Under this situation it is a daydream to put an end to the gun-related crimes in the U.S. 
					
					 Progressive and reactionary nature of society depends on how much independence and vital rights of human beings are respected or ensured. In this sense the American society is the most reactionary and unpopular one in the world. 
					
					 The world is spitting at the shameless behavior of the U.S. which likes to cavil about others' "human rights abuses" though it has failed to protect its people's safety. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to mind its own business before taking issue with the human rights of other countries.

articles.title: Heavy Snow and Biting Cold Hit Hard S. Korea
articles.content:
Heavy Snow and Biting Cold Hit Hard S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- South Korea is hit hard by heavy snow and biting cold, according to the south Korean KBS. 
					 Since January 18 there has been heavy snow, causing temperature to sharply drop. Highways are frozen, triggering off ceaseless traffic accidents. 
					
					 On January 19 more than 20 trucks collided, causing many casualties on the Honam Highway. 
					
					 On the same day there occurred traffic accidents, leaving one dead and more than 10 others wounded in Jonju, North Jolla Province. 
					
					 Boilers were frozen to halt heating service in Seoul. 
					
					 A mountaineer was left dead on Mt. Solak.
					
					 Damage caused by heavy snow and severe cold is on the increase in south Korea.

articles.title: Case of Child Abuse Increases in S. Korea
articles.content:
Case of Child Abuse Increases in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed on Jan. 15 that the father of a family in Puchon City, Kyonggi Province, south Korea killed his 7 years old son, and put him in a refrigerator for over three years.
					 The south Korean KBS said that the recent case is not an individual one but part of overall social evils.
					
					 According to the recent information, 80 percent of perpetrators of child abuse are their parents and 84 percent of the crimes took place in families.
					
					 Various circles of south Korea are calling for making an urgent adoption of a law on preventing the child abuses.
					
					 However, the "National Assembly" is shunning the child abuse and its members are keen on partisan strife and power struggle for hegemony with the approach of the general election.

articles.title: South Korean Authorities Accused of Pushing forward Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law
articles.content:
South Korean Authorities Accused of Pushing forward Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- An editorial titled "'Government' treating the workers as second-class citizens" was posted on the south Korean online paper Voice of People on Jan. 25.
					 The Ministry of Employment and Labor announced the "double guidelines" unfavorable for the workers on Jan. 22, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 The authorities' claim that the general sack guidelines worked out by them were to protect the workers from unreasonable layoff sounded skeptical.
					
					 "The labor standards law", which calls for the approval from the trade unions or majority of the workers when the employment regulations are modified to be unfavorable for the workers, has been nullified.
					
					 The editorial chided the "government" for deciding in the guidelines on such crucial issues related to the existence of workers.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Celebrated in Czech Republic, Mexico
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Celebrated in Czech Republic, Mexico
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in the Czech Republic and a meeting, film show and art performance in Mexico on Jan. 13 and 19 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un dealing with their exploits.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, and books and photos introducing the DPRK building a thriving nation.
					
					 Films shown included Korean film "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation".
					
					 The deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party said in a speech that Korean socialism is victoriously advancing thanks to the immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il despite the imperialists' vicious moves.
					
					 He stressed that the epoch-making events and proud reality of the DPRK would be unthinkable without Kim Jong Il's great exploits.
					
					 A district governor of Mexico City said in a speech that he is learning a lot from the struggle of the Korean people safeguarding the country's sovereignty and security while smashing the imperialist allied forces' moves, true to the road of Songun opened up by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism lauded Kim Jong Il for turning the DPRK into a military power which no one dares provoke with his Songun politics.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Slovenia
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Slovenia
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A Slovenian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Maribor City on Jan. 20.
					 Igor Jurisic, chairman of the Slovenia-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events in praise of the exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the capital and local areas from Jan. 20 to April 18.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A Bangladeshi preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il  (the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Dakha on Jan. 20 at the joint initiative of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the Bangladesh People's League, the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea and the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy.
					 Minister of Civil Aviation and Tourism Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold a meeting, seminar, lecture, film show and other diverse political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary careers of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and exploits of Marshal Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the above-said anniversaries.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Pakistan
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Karachi on Jan. 20.
					 Former Senator Amar Jit was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to arrange diverse political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il to mark the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: DPRK's H-Bomb Test Hailed by Venezuelan Newspaper
articles.content:
DPRK's H-Bomb Test Hailed by Venezuelan Newspaper
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- The Jan. 16th issue of the Venezuelan newspaper Vea carried a special article titled "H-bomb test is product of the line of simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and building of nuclear force" illustrated with a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 The newspaper said that after the DPRK conducted the H-bomb test the world is astonished to see how the DPRK has developed the updated technology which has been monopolized by the big powers.
					
					 The DPRK is asserting that its H-bomb test is neither a provocation nor threat to any country and it is aimed to ensure peace in the Korean Peninsula, the newspaper said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK, said that the DPRK's H-bomb test is a self-defensive measure for reliably ensuring peace in the Korean Peninsula and regional security from the threat of the U.S.-led imperialists for a nuclear war.
					
					 The DPRK clarified its stance that it will stop nuclear test if the U.S. responds to former's proposal for concluding a peace treaty and halts the annual joint military drills with south Korea.
					
					 The DPRK's H-bomb test is the essential and normal process for safeguarding the sovereignty of the country and vital rights of the nation from outsiders' threat.
					
					 However, the U.S. is persistently insisting that it opens the door for dialogue and the DPRK should take a measure for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and stop to "provocation", to begin with.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Hailed by Polish, Nigerian Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Hailed by Polish, Nigerian Organizations
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- Polish and Nigerian Organizations hailed the successful first H-bomb test of Juche Korea.
					 The Polish Branch of the Korean Friendship Association said in a statement on Jan. 9 extended warm congratulations to the government and people of the DPRK on their successful H-bomb test.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The DPRK was compelled to have no choice but to opt for developing its nuclear program in order to safeguard it from the U.S. persistent nuclear threat and blackmail.
					
					 For the DPRK, to dismantle its nuclear weapons is just like to drop a hunting gun before a pack of hungry wolves as it has been exposed to the U.S. constant nuclear threat.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said in an article posted on its website on Jan. 7:
					
					 The DPRK's H-bomb test was a self-defensive measure for thoroughly safeguarding the country's sovereignty and national right to existence from the daily increasing nuclear threat and blackmail of the U.S.-led hostile forces and reliably ensuring peace in the Korean Peninsula and regional security.
					
					 The DPRK clarified that as a responsible nuclear weapons state it would neither be the first to use nuclear weapons nor transfer relevant means and technology under any circumstances as already declared as long as the hostile forces for aggression do not encroach upon its sovereignty.

articles.title: DPRK's Access to Nuclear Weapons Supported by French Internet News
articles.content:
DPRK's Access to Nuclear Weapons Supported by French Internet News
 Pyongyang, January 26 (KCNA) -- A French internet news service said on Jan. 13 that the DPRK's access to the nuclear weapons is a product of the U.S. hostile policy towards it.
					 The news service noted that the DPRK has never threatened any country.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The government and people of the DPRK are making efforts to defend the country's sovereignty from the U.S. constant threat and blackmail.
					
					 The DPRK is well aware of the fact that it could not stand up against the U.S. imperialists without strong military muscle through the lessons drawn from its own and other countries' histories.
					
					 The Western countries forget the fact that the DPRK was severely destroyed by the U.S. forces' merciless bombing during the Korean War but the Korean people vividly remember it.
					
					 That is why the DPRK had access to the nuclear deterrent, weathering all difficulties. This could not but be a natural choice prompted by its determination not to suffer the disasters of a war again.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the DPRK will not be the first to use nuclear weapons.
					
					 The U.S. will be compelled to recognize the DPRK's sovereignty.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun califica a EE.UU. de productor de tension militar y crisis de guerra
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun califica a EE.UU. de productor de tension militar y crisis de guerra
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual de este martes, el diario Rodong Sinmun califica a Estados Unidos de autor que vino aumentando la tension militar y la crisis de guerra en la Peninsula Coreana nadando a contrapelo de la aspiracion de la nacion coreana a la paz y la reunificacion en virtud de "tratados" y "convenios" de toda indole concertados con el Sur de Corea. 
					Durante mas de 60 anos pasados posbelicos EE.UU. desarrollo cada ano en el suelo surcoreano los fanaticos ejercicios de guerra nuclear que son fuentes de la agravacion de la tension y la crisis de guerra de la Peninsula Coreana, revela el articulo y continua:
					
					EE.UU. trazo el "OPLAN 5027", "OPLAN 5029", "OPLAN 5030" y otros guiones de guerra de agresion a la RPDC y desarrollo incesantes alborotos belicos amenazando gravemente a la RPDC y acarreando el nubarron de guerra nuclear a la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					En agosto del ano pasado el imperio norteamericano introdujo en el suelo surcoreano enormes medios de guerra y la division combinada Sur de Corea-EE.UU. asumida la "eliminacion de la Direccion Suprema de la RPDC" y "la ocupacion de Pyongyang". Tambien, desplego todos los puestos de mando operacional y libro el simulacro conjunto Ulji Freedom Guardian.
					
					Insatisfecho con esto, instigo a los belicistas surcoreanos a la grave provocacion armada pretextando el incidente de la "explosion de mina" y el de "disparo de proyectil del Norte", llevando asi al borde de la guerra la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					La historia y la realidad demuestran claramente que EE.UU. es el agresor mas descarado, la causa raigal de los sufrimientos y desgracias de la poblacion surcoreana y la horda de belicistas que impide la reconciliacion y unidad de la nacion coreana y la reunificacion de Corea y aumenta la crisis de guerra nuclear.

articles.title: EE.UU. es sociedad mas reaccionaria y antipopular, revela Minju Joson
articles.content:
EE.UU. es sociedad mas reaccionaria y antipopular, revela Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 26 de enero (ACNC) -- Recientemente, una TV de Rumania transmitio que el numero de los norteamericanos muertos en la guerra Sur-Norte, la guerra Estados Unidos-Espana, la Primera y la Segunda Guerra Mundial, la guerra coreana, la vietnamita y las otras registradas en la historia de Estados Unidos, llego en total a un millon 200 mil personas, pero el numero de los muertos por el crimen de fusil en el interior estadounidense en el periodo pacifico, a un millon 400 mil personas.
					 Este dato comprueba evidentemente que EE.UU. es el infierno de la humanidad.
					
					 Adelanta el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este martes y prosigue:
					
					Ahora en EE.UU. se permite legalmente la posesion de armas de los individuos, y el uso de armas se ha convertido en una "cultura", razon por la cual el crimen de fusil sirve del tumor maligno nunca extirpable.
					
					 En la sociedad estadounidense el uso excesivo de fusiles de los individuos se presenta como grave problema.
					
					 Los productores de armas se oponen tenazmente a la medida de restriccion de armas bajo el amparo del Congreso.
					
					 Bajo tales circunstancias acabar con el crimen de fusiles en EE.UU. deviene una vana ilusion.
					
					 El caracter progresista y el reaccionario de la sociedad se deciden por como se respetan y se aseguran la independencia y el derecho a vivir del hombre, ser social.
					
					 En tal sentido, la sociedad norteamericana es la mas reaccionaria y antipopular en el mundo.
					
					 El mundo condena la postura descarada de EE.UU. que prefiere a descubrir y censurar las "faltas de derechos humanos" de otros paises a pesar de que no defiende la seguridad de la vida de sus habitantes.
					
					 EE.UU. debe cuidar primero los asuntos de su pais antes de cuestionar los DDHH de otros paises.
